thread.title: Shotgun blast into South Land Park apartment wall lands man in jail
thread.title_full: Shotgun blast into South Land Park apartment wall lands man in jail

author:
Bill Lindelof 
blindelof@sacbee.com
title: Shotgun blast into South Land Park apartment wall lands man in jail
text:
Shotgun blast into South Land Park apartment wall lands man in jail 
Believed to have discharged shotgun from his apartment into adjoining unit 
Covering crime, police and courts in the Sacramento region Kenneth Lee Brown Sacramento Police Department i 
blindelof@sacbee.com 
A man faces several charges related to the firing of a shotgun blast into the wall of his neighborâ€™s apartment in South Land Park, Sacramento police said. 
Police were called to apartments in the 6000 block of South Land Park Drive about 4:30 p.m. Saturday, where they were told that a drunken man had discharged a shotgun from his apartment into an adjacent unit. 
The man, identified by police as Kenneth Lee Brown, 60, fled on foot after firing the weapon, police said in a daily activity log. After an extensive search and some evacuations, Brown was found at a nearby apartment and taken into custody. 
He was arrested and booked into the Sacramento County jail on suspicion of possession of a firearm by a felon, possession of ammunition by a felon, negligent discharge of a weapon and violating probation. 
Officers recovered a shotgun during the investigation.
